competitors.name: IBM Sterling Commerce
competitors.notes: Leading EDI and B2B integration provider with Sterling Integrator and Gentran solutions

competitors.name: OpenText (GXS)
competitors.notes: Major EDI VAN and B2B integration network provider

competitors.name: TrueCommerce
competitors.notes: Cloud-based EDI and supply chain integration provider

competitors.name: Inovis
competitors.notes: EDI and supply chain visibility solutions provider

competitors.name: DiCentral
competitors.notes: EDI compliance and trading partner connectivity solutions

competitors.name: Liaison Technologies
competitors.notes: B2B integration and data management platform provider

context: 2010 was a pivotal year for SPS Commerce as the company completed its IPO on NASDAQ (ticker: SPSC) on April 22, raising approximately $49.1 million. Founded in 1987, SPS Commerce was transitioning to become the largest retail cloud services platform. The EDI market was evolving from traditional VAN services to cloud-based SaaS models. Competition came from both legacy EDI providers like IBM Sterling Commerce and OpenText/GXS, as well as newer cloud-native competitors.
